respStmt.resp: Conversion to TEI based on earlier work for the ENRICH project (enrich@oucs.ox.ac.uk; http://tei.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ENRICH/)

msContents.summary: Guardbook of liturgical and other fragments

recordHist.source: Typescript description by Bodleian library staff, revised by Elizabeth Solopova

msItem.title: Proser
msItem.note: containing proses of St. Ladislaus (Chevalier Repertorium no.12331.), Sts. Peter and Paul (ibid. no.14871), St. Lawrence (ibid. no.10489), and the Virgin (ibid. nos.3783, 1879 and 8487)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 39 lines

history.provenance: On fol.1 ‘Exitus vinorum anni 1549 Episcopatus Agriensis [Eger, Hungary]’

msItem.title: Epistle book
msItem.note: containing portions of epistles from Pentecost to the 12th Sunday after Pentecost

supportDesc.foliation: the first leaf with the original foliation cxx

layoutDesc.layout: Gothic notation on 10 staves of two black, one yellow and one red lines

msItem.title: Order of the mass
msItem.note: from the end of the canon to the prayers after mass

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 34 lines

msItem.title: Sacramentary
msItem.note: portions of the temporale from the twentieth Sunday after Pentecost to the Sunday before Christmas; portions of the sanctorale for 9 June - 14 August (fol.8v)

layoutDesc.layout: 32 long lines

history.provenance: From Auct. 5.Q.2.19, which belonged to the Franciscans of Freising

msItem.title: Epistle and gospel book
msItem.note: portion of the 19th Sunday after Trinity and the subsequent week and (fol.14) vigil and feast of St. Andrew,

layoutDesc.layout: long lines

history.provenance: From Auct. 5.Q.2.19, which belonged to the Franciscans of Freising

msItem.title: Office lectionary
msItem.note: sanctorale: matins of the invention of the cross, Sts. Alexander, Eventius and Theodulus, and St. John before the Latin gate (3–6 May)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 35 lines

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: temporale: Monday of the second week after Easter to the second Sunday after Easter and (fol.71, 72) third and fourth Sundays after Easter

supportDesc.extent: 4 leaves (outer bifolia of quire) and part of a bifolium

layoutDesc.layout: 24 long lines. Notation adiastematic neums

history.provenance: Taken from Auct. Q. sub fen.3

msItem.title: Antiphonal
msItem.note: containing portions of the week before Christmas, of the O antiphons in a version different from the Roman series (fol.23), and of the vigil of Christmas (fol.24). A later hand added the antiphon [O Thoma] didime

supportDesc.extent: Parts of 4 leaves (inner bifolia of quire)

layoutDesc.layout: notation adiastematic neums, 17 long lines

history.provenance: Written across fol.22v and 23 is ‘Iste liber est beate Marie virginis in Scheyren [Scheyern, dioc. Freising]’
Taken from Auct. Q. sub fen.3

msItem.title: Antiphonal
msItem.note: sanctorale for 24 Aug.-8 Sept.

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on 13 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Antiphonal
msItem.note: temporale: portion of Sunday and Monday of the third week in Advent

layoutDesc.layout: fine, square notation on 15 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Breviary, Use of Sarum (choir breviary)
msItem.note: temporale: responsories of the 2nd Sunday in Advent
Another leaf, containing a portion of the common of the dedication is in MS. Lat. liturg. a. 8, fol.42

supportDesc.extent: half of a page and four fragments

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on 11 staves of 4 red lines, 2 cols.

msItem.title: Antiphonal, Use of Hereford (?)
msItem.note: sanctorale containing the feast of St. Thomas de Cantilupe

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on 14 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Breviary, Use of Sarum (choir breviary)
msItem.note: sanctorale: portion of the Nativity of the Virgin. Two leaves from this MS. containing portions of matins for Good Friday are MS. Lat. liturg. d. 16, fol.33, 34

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on 11 staves of 4 red lines, 2 cols.
square notation on 14 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: part of the common of an apostle

msItem.title: Antiphonal
msItem.note: containing settings for the Venite and the hymn Jesu corona virginum. Two further leaves are in pr. book G.G. 6 Th., see Ker, Pastedowns in Oxford bindings, nos.1235, 1236

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols. Square notation on 13 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Gradual, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: containing portions of the common of several confessors and of a virgin and martyr

msItem.title: Breviary, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: temporale: end of the second and beginning of the third week in Lent

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., square notation on staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: temporale: portions of the Saturday after the 4th Sunday in Lent and Monday after Passion Sunday

layoutDesc.layout: notation adiastematic neums

msItem.title: Breviary (choir breviary)
msItem.note:
temporale: 6th
Sunday after Pentecost

layoutDesc.layout: notation adiastematic neuns, 2 cols.

msItem.title: Psalter
msItem.note: two fragments containing portions of Ps. xxix, xxx, lvii and lviii

msItem.title: Missal, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: temporale: Wednesday and Friday in the Advent ember days

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: temporale: portion of the passion of Palm Sunday, with parts marked f, c and t

layoutDesc.layout: 25 long lines

msItem.title: Breviary, monastic (?)
msItem.note: sanctorale for 2–11 Nov.

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., square notation on staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Gradual
msItem.note: temporale: portions of 12th–19th Sundays after Pentecost; sanctorale: sequences for St. John the Evangelist, Holy Innocents' Day, Epiphany, Purification and Easter

supportDesc.extent: bifolium, the middle of each page now lost

layoutDesc.layout: notation adiastematic neums

history.provenance: Taken from Auct.5.Q. infra I.ii, from Beyharting, upper Bavaria

msItem.title: Breviary (Cistercian portable breviary)
msItem.note: sanctorale: portion of St. Vincent, conversion of St. Paul, the Purification, St. Agatha and the Annunciation

layoutDesc.layout: 30 long lines

binding.p: Bound along the upper edge, so as to allow the book to be hung from the girdle, cf. MS. Canon. liturg. 237

history.provenance: From Auct. 5. Q. inf. I.8 which belonged to the monastery of St. Magnus, Stadtamhof

layoutDesc.layout: Gothic notation on 10 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Te Deum of Our Lady
msItem.note: not among those pr. by W. Legg, Trans. St. Paul's Ecclesiological Soc. III, 34–40

msItem.title: sequence for the Nativity
msItem.note: (Chevalier no.19504)

msItem.title: Sacramentary
msItem.note: containing portions of masses from the vigil to the octave of Christmas

decoDesc.decoNote: two initials drawn in red outline with scrolls and acanthus foliage

msItem.title: Sacramentary (?)
msItem.note: containing portions of votive masses pro salute vivorum, [pro tribulatis], pro familia ecclesiastica

layoutDesc.layout: long lines

msItem.title: Office of the dead
msItem.note: containing most of matins

msItem.title: Breviary (choir breviary)
msItem.note: sanctorale: portions of the offices of Sts. Maurice, Michael and Andrew

layoutDesc.layout: notation fine adiastematic neums of the St. Gall type, long lines

msItem.title: Gradual
msItem.note: containing portion of the mass of St. John the Baptist, and in a later hand the introit of a votive mass ‘pro fratribus et sororibus’ and a mass of St. Anne

layoutDesc.layout: square notation with some neums on 17 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: containing the gospel of a votive mass ‘pro iter agentibus’

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.note: (4 lines)
msItem.incipit: Je puys dormyr se ne suys ivre

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Breviary (monastic choir breviary)
msItem.note: containing part of a homily and a melody of the Venit

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Calendar (secular)
msItem.note: with obits and some 13th cent. feasts added

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols.

msItem.title: Lectionary (monastic office lectionary)
msItem.note: containing lessons from the homily Dominus et salvator noster and portions of lessons for the common of a martyr

supportDesc.extent:
parts of three leaves
195
(combined width of columns)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols.

msItem.title: Antiphonal
msItem.note: containing portions of three tones for the Venite

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on 13 staves of 4 red lines, 2 cols.

msItem.title: Proser
msItem.note: (portions of proses from Easter to the Assumption)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 30 lines

msItem.title: Missal, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: sanctorale: portions of feasts from 14 to 17 Sept., including the mass of the relics

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 35 lines

msItem.title: Proser (noted)
msItem.note: containing portions of proses, Chevalier nos.17353 and 10840

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on 10 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Breviary (choir breviary)
msItem.note: strip containing portion of the sanctorale for the end of April, including the Translationoff St. Edmund (29th April)

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Breviary, Use of Sarum (choir breviary)
msItem.note: strip containing parts of sext and none of several virgins

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Antiphonal
msItem.note: portions of the temporale for Whitsuntide and Trinity Sunday

layoutDesc.layout: gothic notation on staves of four or five black lines

msItem.title: Reject leaf
msItem.note: containing part of the Venite

layoutDesc.layout: ruled for 23 lines, space for notation left blank

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: containing portions of the ferial psalter and (fol.97) of two offices of the dead

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 23 lines, Gothic notation on 12 staves of 4 black lines

msItem.title: Gradual
msItem.note: portions of the sanctorale for 12–26 June, with a proper mass of St. Odulf

layoutDesc.layout: Gothic notation on 10 staves of 4 or 5 black lines

msItem.title: Gradual
msItem.note: portions of the sanctorale for 24 Aug. - 9 Sept.

layoutDesc.layout: Gothic notation on staves of 5 black lines

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: containing portions of votive masses of the Cross, the Holy Ghost and the Virgin

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 26 lines

msItem.title: Portion of rules for the melodic ‘differentiae’
msItem.note: which appears to have been added on a page left blank after an interval melody

layoutDesc.layout: Gothic notation on staves of 3–4 black lines

msItem.title: Antiphonal
msItem.note: (cutting: initial o, the beginning of the antiphon O admirable commercium)

supportDesc.extent: part of a leaf of a very large antiphonal

msItem.title: Sacramentary
msItem.note: containing portion of the order of the mass, masses of a ‘dominica sexta’, Sts. Sylvester, Basilius and Odile, Paul the hermit and Hilary

layoutDesc.layout: 25 long lines

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: containing portions of masses for Eastertide

supportDesc.foliation: original foliation of cxviii and cxxviii

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols.

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: temporale:portions from the second Sunday after the Epiphany to Sexagesima

layoutDesc.layout: written in long lines, notation adiastematic neums, St. Gall type

history.provenance: ‘Sum Arnoldi [Hemminck] grammatici … Dullmaniensis....’ (fol.110v); his name appears also in pr. book Auct. 7.Q.3.42 from which these leaves were taken

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: temporale: portions of the first and second weeks in Advent, of the office of the dead (fol.112) and compline (fol.113)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 55 lines or square notation on 18 staves of 4 red lines

msItem.title: Breviary (choir breviary)
msItem.note: temporale: portions of matins and lauds of Passion Sunday

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 32 lines or square notation on 16 staves of 4 red lines

history.provenance: Given by the Wilts. Archeol. Soc., 1933

msItem.title: Missal, Use of Rome
msItem.note: temporale: portions of masses from the second to the fourth Sunday in Advent

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 29 lines

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: containing portions of the sanctorale for 30 July - 15 Aug.

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 28 lines

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: sanctorale: portions of Sts. Peter and Paul and of the Commemoration of St. Paul

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 33 lines

history.provenance: Given by F. W. Potts Hicks, 1950

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols.

history.provenance: Given by Messrs. A. Maltby & Son, 1950

msItem.title: Missal, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: temporale: text and rubrics following the reception of the penitents on Maundy Thursday

supportDesc.extent: part of a leaf, badly damaged

msItem.title: Breviary (choir breviary)
msItem.note: sanctorale: portions of the Decollation of St. John the Baptist and of a proper office of St. Giles, who is honoured as patron

layoutDesc.layout: square notation on 17 staves of 4 red lines, 2 cols.
